description: Create admin-service for dashboard metrics and aggregated data
steps: - DashboardTotals: users, students, educators, courses, coursesOnline, coursesPresencial, revenue (thisMonth, lastMonth), enrollments (thisMonth, lastMonth)
- RecentActivity: id, type (enrollment | payment | course_completed | new_user | transfer_pending | coupon_used), description, timestamp
- DashboardMetrics: totals, charts (revenue, enrollments, userGrowth), recentActivity, topCourses
- getDashboardMetrics(): DashboardMetrics - aggregates all metrics for the admin dashboard
- getDashboardTotals(): DashboardTotals - counts users, students, educators, courses by type
- getRevenueChart(months: number): ChartDataPoint[] - revenue per month for last N months
- getEnrollmentsChart(months: number): ChartDataPoint[] - enrollments per month
- getUserGrowthChart(months: number): ChartDataPoint[] - cumulative user count per month
- getRecentActivity(limit: number): RecentActivity[] - recent platform activity
- getTopCourses(limit: number): TopCourse[] - courses by revenue and enrollments
Use Prisma aggregations for efficient queries
Verify with pnpm lint, pnpm typecheck, pnpm build in sequence

description: Extend student-service with admin functions
steps: - StudentWithStats: Student with enrollmentsCount, completedCourses, totalSpent, lastActivityAt
- getAllStudentsWithStats(): StudentWithStats[] - all students with computed stats for admin
- getStudentStats(): StudentStats - aggregated statistics for dashboard cards
- getStudentById(id): StudentWithStats | null - full student details with stats
- updateStudentAsAdmin(id, data): Student - admin update (can update more fields)
- getStudentsByActivity(days: number): StudentWithStats[] - students active in last N days
Use efficient Prisma queries with includes for related data
Verify with pnpm lint, pnpm typecheck, pnpm build in sequence

description: Extend educator-service with admin functions
